intro: Gyrostachys lupulina, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Gyrostachys lupulina is adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
